text:
I want to like this place, I really do. The food's good, the poutines are innovative, the beer is cheap, the atmosphere's decent. 

But, egads, the service is *awful*. Waiters are surly and rude and act like they're doing you a giant favour to take a round of drink orders -- when you can find them, that is. 

And, contrary to prior reviews, this place is cash-only and gives you a stinkload of attitude when you try to pay with a card. I mean, we're not talking about a small-ticket place; tabs can easily run $50-$60 in the course of a night. I don't know anyone who carries that sort of cash around. For a business to not take credit or even debit cards, and then get mad at customers for daring to even ask, in 2014, is IMHO unforgiveable. The server haughtily informed us that it was "choix de l'entreprise". Well, my "choix de client" is not to go back. There are plenty of other Irish pubs in this city.

Honestly i've been there a few times and never had bad service. However the last time i went there, a huge fly flew into my drink because they left the terrace open. When i asked if they could exchange it, they refused and said they would charge me for it, and they had no control
Over it being summer outside. He was VERY rude and there was no customer or quality of service. And he had no zero consideration for keeping the customer happy. Might have been the bar mgr. the server just went a long with what he said

After visiting St. Joseph oratory, my friend and I went to this bar. I ordered two glasses of beer, and I had to pay every time I ordered. The beer was good, so I made the payment plus some tips for the first beer. When I asked a busser (I didn't know if the person was a busser or not at that time) for one more beer, my friend and I were made to wait for 15 minutes just to order. And when we left, we paid the exact amount of the bill in cash, but the waitress told me "Service is not included." and didn't leave our table until I paid a tip. Who would want to pay a tip after being made to wait so long? I was shocked at her sense of entitlement.

This place just got better now that it's not cash only anymore! They have some of the best burgers in town ... not just one or two types but several delicious burger options. Their poutines are also good!

The crowd tends to be predominantly young adults/students - a great spot to watch the game or head out with your friends for a 5@7!

This is a spot where I bring all my friends who visit the cote des neiges area. The service is straightforward. What I like best is the division of different areas in the pub. Some areas are louder and music oriented... Some areas at the back area are generally more quiet for a date type setting. Very nice. 
-Food is good but I do not purchase it a lot due to the drinks being so good and only the need for a small snack. Their portions look huge so it is for people who prefer a larger plate! 
First pub where even the low priced beer tastes amazing and different/cleaner than most other bars. 
Definitely recommend. Keep up the good work! 
It shows as this pub is very often full

There's one of the best burger I've ever eaten ! Go for the Edson 1884 ! The atmosphere is really nice, they offer a large selection of beer, a simple great moment. 
I'd recommend this place so far !
Burgers were trash salad and beer selection good decent music and overall good place but the burgers people on the reviews say we're good must not have a BBQ blah ............

Pub & restaurant irlandais assez... A la brute ^^ deco qui faut très brasserie, avec tout en vieux bois, plutôt sympa je trouve, énormément de variétés de bière pr les amateurs de bières! 
Et les plats proposés pr le lunch ou diner, sont assez bons! Et a bons prix! Disons que le Canada m'avait habituée a un peu plus cher, donc c'est tant mieux ;)


 Pr ma part, j'ai pris des ailes de poulet! Délicieusement caramélisées! Et mon amis, un burger au saumon! Pas mal aussi ;)
les frites y sont... Hmm al dente!! Faites comme a la maison!!! ^^


 La petite * en moins.. C'est juste le temps de service que j'ai trouvé un peu plus long qu'ailleurs, un peu.....


 Je recommande! ^__^

I've been to McCarold's several times and will definitely be back several times more. They have a great beer and scotch selection  and the atmosphere is always friendly and chill.

Their kitchen also makes great pub food: make sure you try their onion rings! They have TVs, but they're on only when the Habs are playing, which is great (I typically dislike TVs at bars).

Only drawback is that you need to remember it is cash only.
Notre resto préféré sur côte-des-neiges. On a déjà testé toute la carte. Ce que je préfère c'est la pizza à la guiness et le burger au brie.
It's a student bar, but it's clean and comfortable. Seating in the back is quieter and the food is middle of the road, but better than other pub fare in the area.

Had the Irish stew with a five dollar pint of Boreale. For a twenty dollar lunch it was decent, but not exceptional. The service was great, as I was the first lunch client. The order was prompt, we were served within  mins. The stew should have had more taste...it was sort of meh.

Y prendre un verre entre ami est un régal, car ce pub s'y prête bien! Après on peut y manger si l'on a faim, mais cette place est davantage un bar qu'un restaurant.
Placé à côté de l'université de Montréal, c'est une bonne référence pour aller boire un verre après les cours ou lors d'une fin de semaine. La détente y est garantie!
Ambiance chaleureuse. Bonnes bière et cocktails de bière. Bouffe réconfortante. La place est rarement vide le midi et le soir!

J'y suis allée avec une amie fêter notre admission au DDN. J'ai bien aimé le service, relaxe, belle ambiance.

Prix abordables, des grosses portions. Je n'ai pas étécapable de terminer mon assiette de Fish & Chips, pourtant délicieuse.

We came with a group. We all ordered poutines and found that some of them were a bit cold. Nonetheless, good enough to be drank with their great selection of beers. I liked that the interior wasn't too dark like it's the case with Irish pubs.

The setting is pretty good, both inside with the Irish Pub feel and outside on the patio. I thought the Chuck Norris poutine was overrated out of scale though. There's something about the combination of too-strong green shallots and sesame flavour that made it feel like a poor attempt at creating Asian fusion poutine. The pieces of soft rubber that I later found to be philly steak added no value at all. I was not a fan.

May there be a better poutine at McCarold's so that I can give a proper rating.

After a long cold walk we decided to stop off here to grab a quick bite. 
Wasn't impressed with the food.
Got cheese sticks with cheddar cheese. Really nothing special no cheese in them at all. Comes with sour cream and salsa very meh. Go to nickels if u want cheese sticks lol.

Another thing now With the new law you have to get ur bill after each drink which is fine but then our waitress came up pressuring us to pay our bill now because she was leaving and wanted her tip. I understand how you have to leave but by doing so I didn't buy anything else.

The inside is nice and cozzy and very dark and dingy in a great way.

Went there on a Sunday afternoon for a family reunion.  The server was very attentive and friendly. We all got different types of burgers and we were all pleased. It comes with home fries and a delicious house mayo. They have a pretty large variety of beers on tap and other types of liquors and and cocktails. 

If you hesitate on what kind of draught beer to get with your meal, don't hesitate to ask your server for recommendations according to what you are eating and even get a little sample to taste.

Nice place but very busy for a Friday happy hour. Disappointed in the service and that they don't accept credit & debit cards. Also they don't take reservations. Will consider this place for the future with friends.
It is 2015 and this place does not take credit cards. I will never go back. Big problem!

Un samedi avant cinq heure, les tables sont manquantes de ses convives. Alors l'atmosphère conséquent se colle entre les murs encore vide. Mais bon. Bien heureux qu'il y a de la New Castle en bouteille. 

Nous étions servis aux burgers proposants champignons sautés et mozzarella fondu. Bien que familier au goût, j'ai apprécié le pain choisi. Légèrement sucré et assez dense pour absorber le tout.

Close pub I like to go too. Went on a friday night music was boring though. Friends said poutine was good. However nachos didnt have much cheese mostly black olives..got a blonde beer tasting was fun to share and try different beers.

What dilemma I have here. How to review McCarold's! Argh...

Cute place. Typical pub decor, which is perfectly fine... It's a pub. Tasty enough food. Great beer. But....

But the service! OMG the service. Is it still called service if you don't get any? And I'm not talking a Friday night here. I'm talking 3pm on a sunday. Our group of 7 was like invisible. 

"excuse me, can I place an order? Excuse me, water please. Excuse my, does a fork come with the poutine?" seriously, don't make us chase you for everything when the place isn't full. It's really my only knock on the place.

Avec toi, ça dépend des jours. Des fois, ton service est vraiment bien, des fois, il l'est moins. Des fois, j'ai envie de rester longtemps, des fois non. Jamais tu n'acceptes le paiement avec cartes, des fois ça me dérange, des fois non. 

Tes plats sont toujours délicieux et il est agréable de boire quelques bières entre amis chez toi, particulièrement à la sortie des cours. Ton décor nous rappelle vraiment les pubs classiques d'Irlande et tes effluves de bière et de poutine se mélangent avec celles des étudiants parfumés du HEC. 

À la prochaine quand même, parce qu'à Côte-des-Neiges, tu as peu de compétition, disons-le!
J'adore cet endroit, j'y allais quand j'étais aux Hec c'est tout proche. Les burgers sont divins, les salades... Tout!
Great student bar. Many excellent deals that will considered a steal by most students around the area! Excellent atmosphere that would drown the sun itself.

Venu un vendredi soir à 4 pour 18h30 on a un peu galérer pour trouver une table mais nous avons réussi. 
Il y a une salle au fond et je vous la conseille car vous serez bien plus au calme que dans la salle principale

Le choix de boisson est conséquent. que cela soit des bières, des cocktails à base de bière, des cocktails classiques ...

Pour manger nous avons pris des poutines dont la cheesy jack et la steak philly.
Les 2 étaient bonnes et mention particulière à la cheesy jack.
Les portions grandes sont costauds et vont définitivement vous remplir le ventre.

Les prix sont dans la normal et ce qui est affiché inclus les taxes.

Joli endroit pour boire de la bière et manger pour pas trop cher.
Belle  ambiance . Les bières sont bonnes . Bonne soupe à l'oignon .Bonne musique  . Assez bondé

I had such a nice first visit here today! I found the service super chill and friendly and helpful, and I liked the look and feel of the bar a lot. Lots of beautiful wood and nice layout with big communal tables, small private corners and lots of space for the gangs of students that I'm sure cram in here. We were there on a Saturday afternoon so there was a nice mix of people reading or working on laptops, couples hanging out, groups of friends, etc and it kept filling up over the 2 hours we were there. 

There was a nice collection of beers, though a few more smaller local brews would be fun additions. The poutine with deep fried jalapenos I tried was tasty, good fries, and the heat from the peppers cut the gravy nicely. Not amaaazing brown gravy, but totally tasty. I'll definitely come back, I liked the vibe, and the fish and chips at the other table looked like something I could sink my teeth into...

Le pub branché de la Côte des neiges ! Je le recommande pour y prendre un verre entre amis si on habite le quartier ! On peut également y manger un ptit bout, je recommande leurs hamburger et leur poutine n'est pas mal non plus ! 
C'est toujours bondé et une bonne ambiance y règne ! 

A tester si ce n'est pas encore fait !

I started off with a sangria on the menu and mac & cheese. The sangria was perfect, not too sweet and not too alcoholic in taste, it was just right. The mac and cheese were good enough. One thing I notice from the food, it was a little dry and it sticks on the plate. My coworker didn't finish her mussels, I took it from her and I ate the rest. The mussels were alright too. I think all mussels, regardless where it came from, it tastes the same everywhere. The only exception is when the mussels have gone bad, I haven't had the experience of tasting bad mussels yet, certainly not in this pub. The other order I had the pleasure of eating, it was the Plourde soup, a mixture of seafood cover in a creamy soup. This one is alright. I think I would like it if I was still very hungry. 

Overall, this restaurant gets 3 stars. The customer service was a lot better than the food itself.  Probably a couple of changes on the cooking will do this restaurant justice. The booze isn't so bad either.
Lovely atmosphere, great food, good music, lively, good drinks. Nothing bad to say. The lamb burger is to dieeee for. Yum.

Came to this Pub to watch World Cup two days in a row great service staff is mostly French speaking .  you work your way through it. Ordered the same beet salad special 2 days in a row day one was perfect great presentation right size plate day 2 look like a totally different dish smoked salmon beet salad and I had to ask l the staff at the give me cheese cuz it was no cheese on my salad which says in the ingredients but besides that all good consistency cleanliness and service is what we look for and we will go back to the same place over and over and over again.

I came here once only on a weeknight. The place seemed busy for 12ish in the night. They had two rooms, and also have a terrase open whenever the weather plays fair. Staff service was fast and friendly. And the bartenders attentive. The kitchen closes at 12 but thankfully theres McD's and Timmies nearby. The only minus for me here was that they dont keep tabs and the cash only policy. Thats one of the reasons why I'm not a regular here even though I am in the neighbourhood. Crowd is young and mostly of students so I guess thats the reason why. Anyways I would have come here more often and stayed longer if they allowed tabs and at least taken at least accepted some sort of card transactions. Drinks were good and the price decent too. An okay hangout spot :)

Français après.

Chili Con Carne in a Irish pub? Hell yeah, and it's damn good and cheap. It's a bar with a really young crowd somehow pretty bilingual not to say lot of other Languages. Cote-Des-Neiges must be one of the most multi-cultural place in Montreal I would dear to say.. Of Course it is beside UdeM (Université de Montréal) and their campus so it explains the fact it's pretty much always average to busy. Price are like every average pub in montreal 7.50-8$ a pint (english pint, not your tiny american ones),So it's expensive to get drunk there, but it's a really nice get-together place especially if you have friends to meet after course at UdeM.
You have lot of Banks near for the ones who hate bank fees. They take Credit cards so you can start a tab if you ask.

Du Chili con Carne dans un Pub Irlandais? Met-en pis y'é vraiment pas pire pis surtout pas cher. C'est vraiment une place qui est presque toujours un peu rempli a pas mal remplies. C'est aussi une place autant d'anglais que de français. Ça s'explique par le quartier. Côte-Des-Neiges c'est vraiment une des rues les plus multi-ethnique de montréal. Il y a un marché pas loin avec une forte population russe ou européenne de l'est proche de l'Oratoire plus haut. Puis t'as aussi accès à des Guichets pas trop loin (un RBC dans le Esso en diagonale, une caisse a deux pas et une nationale aussi je pense! Pratique pour les gens qui n'aimes pas trop les guichets ATM avec 2-3 $ de frais. ) Y acceptes les cartes de credit et guichet donc vous pouvez vous partir un bill.
Le prix des pintes est à peu près la moyenne des pub typiques: 7-8$
Finally a bar with bartenders that know how to make great drinks properly! I had many pints of perfectly poured Guinness. Thank you!!!
Good place for a nice pint of beer. Lack of Irish music to make it feel more..."Irish" but still a nice place, easy access and nice atmosphere. Food is good too.

Landed here via the Metro on a suggestion from a local as I love a good pint of Guinness.  They definitely came though! Great local pub with a good draft. Bartender made a few foo foo drinks too. Plenty of food for all tastes. Reasonable prices and a friendly bartender made us feel welcomed.  Great place to kill a couple of hours. Girls-hooks for your purse under the bar. Nice touch. Recommended?  YES if you like  great pints of beer, conversation, fresh air, good food and fun. Just my opinion.
Good comfort food selection and taste. Burger and friends are a must. So-so prices. Quick and courteous services.

Bonne musique (généralement du rock avec ses variantes), belle ambiance pour ceux aimant les bars étudiants et il y a des TV au canal du sport (idéal pour les amateurs de hockey). De plus, la clientèle est universitaire plutôt que cégepienne (comme ça l'est à l'autre bar étudiant quelques rues plus loin). 

L'endroit a certainement du charme, surtout grâce à son petit passage menant à une seconde et une troisième pièce qui sont très chaleureuses. 

Le plat favorit de mes amis et moi est, exclusivement, le paté au poulet et poireau. Leur sélection de bière internationale est diversifiée et délicieuse.

Si vous êtes pressés ce n'est pas l'endroit car les serveurs sont un peu lents (mais généralement sympatiques). De plus, j'ai pu observer qu'ils mettent dehors de manière très polie les clients saouls causant des problèmes :)

Une place un peu bof trop centrée sur le sport aux écrans. Le son y est beaucoup trop fort. On y devient sourd, on s'entend mal et le service est long. On y va 2/3 fois entre couilles et on y revient plus.

There wasn't anything overly exciting about this place, but I liked it. I visited on a Monday evening with three guys from my hockey team. Surprisingly, for a Monday, the place was very packed. It was mostly a student or new grad crowd so there was an energy about the place. Lot's of draft beer options. Prices of the food surprised me for a pub, but the service was good. No complaints. Good pub experience.

Je cherchais à prendre un verre avec des amis mais je n'avais pas envie de faire de line-up ou bien d'avoir à être trop habillée, donc lorsque quelqu'un a suggéré d'aller à Mc Carold's, c'était exactement ce qu'il me fallait.

C'est un pub irlandais où l'on peut aller prendre une bouchée, un verre ou deux (ou trois ou quatre) sans avoir à sortir les poches vides. La nourriture est bonne - on s'est partagée une géante poutine au smoked-meat  à trois et la sauce dans laquelle les frites étaient noyées était très goûteuse et bien agencée aux saveurs de la viande. La liste des bières est variée avec autant, si pas plus, de bières québécoises que de bières internationales.

Un autre point de plus pour cet endroit - le pub est à deux pas du métro donc il est assez facile à trouver et c'est beaucoup plus motivant d'y aller, même dans des journées de grosses tempêtes, si un ami décide d'y faire la fête!

Such a great place to relax. The interior sends you to Ireland. It's a place where you feel really welcome. The menu will for sure have something for everyone. Poutines, burgers, sandwiches, fries, onions rings, name it! I got myself a large smoked meat poutine which was delicious. For the price I expected a bit more for my belly but it was preeeeetty good. It's near UdeM and Brebeuf and right outside the metro of Côte-des-Neiges!!! How awesome is that!!! You're tired after a day at school and there's a pub right there! RIGHT THERE!!!!!

In an area full of students, close to Université de Montréal, McCarold offers great deals in beer and pub fare. Where else can you get a pint for 4 to 5$ ?
They serve local brews and Irish classics. 

It is a great place to watch a game, with quite a few TVs. The ambiance is cosy with a lot of wood.

Aside the usual pub food, the chicken wings and whiskey-flavored poutine stand out.

We've been there many times. The cider is really good, the foods are amazing (exactly burgers and the Cesar's salads), the amount is perfect, the guys are kind. 
The price is good.
The only "problem" you cannot pay by card, but there's an ATM inside.

Large beer selection.  Music was on point. Poutine bites were very savory  ...but where they lack is in their burgers. Tasted like frozen beef patties. Had better burgers at your average fast food joint.

Tout pub dans un quartier universitaire guarantit quasi tout le temps un bon deal! Les étudiants aiment quelque chose de bon, beau (pas tout le temps) et pas cher! Et bien voilà! McCarold's est une destination de choix! Souvent rempli à craquer, les serveurs s'assurent quand même de bien répondre à tous leurs clients avec la même qualité! Et sérieux, j'ai été vraiment impressionnée par leur burger! Tellement juteux tout en étant un peu croustillant à l'extérieur! Celui que j'avais choisi était garni d'un bon gros morceau de fromage bleu... Mmmm mmm mmm! le meilleur ami du boeuf (selon moi!) Leur poutine est également un délice! J'ai faim rien qu'à y penser! Alors la prochaine fois que vous êtes dans le coin de l'UdeM, passez y faire un tour!

McCarold's pub is where j'ai vraiment appris le français. After horribly-structured and obligatory French classes à l'Université de Montréal or orchestra rehearsals, or just to watch a hockey game after a long day in the trombone mines, McCarold's is easily the most well-run and pleasant establishment in MTL qui commence avec un Mc.  It's effectively an annex of l'UdeM.  Maybe just the faculté de musique?

The downside: cash-only, and the service ne fonctionne vraiment en anglais, MAIS if you can deal with speaking French, the servers are just as nice/efficient as any pub/restaurant that you can expect to find in MTL...which still isn't very good.

As an alma mater of l'UdeM paying international student fees, I came to appreciate the cash-only nature of the place as I would be less likely to get myself into a troubling amount of debt while un étudiant.  So actually scratch those to downsides on second thought.

As for the upsides, I'm clearly a fan of this place.  They play the hockey matches, they have nice and reasonably priced pub fare (big burgers, solid poutines), et la séléction des bières gives all of them international students at UdeM a nice idea of local mid-market beers.  As far as unimportant superficial stuff, the place is nice and woody and looks the way a pub should look.

All in all, this remains a nice pub to go with old or new friends, to just watch a sport game of some sort (they used to play rugby sometimes!), or a decent place in the neighbourhood to grab a beerlunch.

Besides, all the jerks from HEC Montréal don't make it past Tabasco bar, so you don't have to even deal with them.  ;-)
